intro: Cymbalariella, commonly known as the narrow-leaved rock cress, is a small flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in early spring. The plant is typically found in rocky or gravelly soils in alpine or arctic regions. It has a compact growth habit and is often used in rock gardens due to its hardiness and ornamental value. Cymbalariella is a perennial species that thrives in cool, moist environments.
